text.p: Swedish truckmaker Scania said on Friday it has bought privately-owned Scania importer AS Estoscan as part of its strategy for growth in Estonia.

"The development of the market for heavy trucks in Estonia is positive. The turnaround to a market economy in Estonia has gone well, which influences the transport sector," said Scania marketing director Urban Erdtman.

AS Estoscan has been Scania's importer since 1992 and has 34 employees. All employees will be offered positions in the new company. "Scania's purchase means the company will invest in service garages to strengthen our presence in the market," said Erdtman.
In 1996 149 trucks were registered in Estonia and Scania has a 38 percent market share. -- Simon Haydon, Stockholm newsroom +46-8-700-1004
